The capital of Rajasthan boasts of a rich lineage of kin (Read More)gs and is synonymous with royalty and splendour. The magnificent forts and palaces in Jaipur are a livid example of stunning architecture and well-designed gardens, sprawling over acres and acres of land. Some of these forts and palaces have completely been transformed into heritage hotels for you to stay and have a taste of the regalia. However, some of these are still occupied by the newer generations of the original kings. However, to fully witness the grandiosity, you cannot miss visiting these grand palaces in Jaipur while on a trip, which silently narrate in numerous tales of the bygone era, of battles lost and won, of victory and monarchy, of art and architecture. Here is the list of 10 Magnificent Palaces in Jaipur for a Royal Retreat 1. Rambagh Palace 4.7 /5 Located about 8 kms from the city centre of Jaipur, Rambagh Palace is one among the finest palaces of Jaipur. Once a residence of the Maharaja of Jaipur, today the palace has been converted into a luxury heritage resort with brilliant architecture, lighting and facilities. For visiting guests, day tours are offered.Entry Fees (Tours): INR 500 for Foreigners and INR 100 for IndiansLocation: Bhawani Singh Rd, Rambagh, Jaipur Read More 2. City Palace Located in Jaipur, The City Palace is the main palace from where the Maharaja reigned from. This palace in Jaipur includes the Chandra Mahan and Mubarak Mahal along with various other buildings within the complex. It is located towards the north-eastern side of Jaipur.Timings: 9:30 AM to 5 PMEntry Fees: INR 75 for Indians, INR 100 for Foreigners and INR 40 for ChildrenLocation: Tulsi Marg, Gangori Bazaar, J.D.A. Market, Pink City, Jaipur Read More 3. Amber Fort Palace Cradled on the top of the Aravali Hill and forming a beautiful reflection across the Maotha Lake, lies the Amber Fort. An architectural masterpiece and with significant reference in Indian history, it is visited by over five thousand tourists daily. The Fort gives a mesmerizing view from the bottom of the hill when it is illuminated every evening.Timings: 8 AM to 5:30 PM and 6:30 PM to 9:15 PMEntry Fees: INR 200 per PersonLocation: Devisinghpura, Amer, Jaipur. 12 Km from central Jaipur via Amer Rd Read More 4. Rajmahal Palace Built-in 1729, Rajmahal Palace is a symbol of love by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II for his wife. Briefly occupied by the British, this palace in Jaipur has now been restored and converted into a luxury stay. It still houses some of the ancient relics and royal chandeliers from the bygone era.Location: Sardar Patel Marg, Shivaji Nagar, Jaipur Read More Jaipur Travel Packages Compare quotes from upto 3 travel agents for free 2 Nights / 3 Days Weekend Getaway to Jaipur Tour Package Jaipur(2N) Sold By: Abd Holidays Pvt Ltd(4.4 ) ₹ 8,500 20% off ₹6,800/person Get Offers> 6 Nights / 7 Days Jaipur, Jodhpur & Jaisalmer - 6N/7D Jaipur(2N) → Jodhpur(2N) → Jaisalmer(2N) ₹29,400/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Wonderful Rajasthan - New Year Special Package Udaipur(2N) → Jaipur(2N) Sold By: Akbar Holidays Pvt Ltd(4.6 ) ₹ 29,999 10% off ₹26,999/person Get Offers> 6 Nights / 7 Days Rajasthan Royal Package: Jaipur-Jodhpur-Udaipur Jaipur(2N) → Jodhpur(2N) → Udaipur(2N) ₹ 31,280 13% off ₹27,200/person Get Offers> 5 Nights / 6 Days Jaipur Udaipur Pushkar Tour Package with Ajmer Sharif Jaipur(2N) → Pushkar(1N) → Udaipur(2N) ₹20,228/person Get Offers> 5 Nights / 6 Days Fascinating Rajasthan Tour Package Jaipur(2N) → Bikaner(1N) → Jaisalmer(2N) Sold By: Abd Holidays Pvt Ltd(4.4 ) ₹ 16,500 10% off ₹14,800/person Get Offers> View All Packages For Jaipur View All Packages For Jaipur 5. Narain Niwas Palace Built by Thakur of Kanota, General Amar Singh, Narain Niwas Palace boasts of Anglo Indian style of architecture of the Victorian era. This is one of the palaces in Jaipur which has now been converted into a heritage home to give you a glimpse of the opulent royal lifestyle.Location: Hotel Narain Niwas Palace Kanota Bagh, Narayan Singh Rd, Jaipur Read More 6. Samode Palace At a distance of around 56 kms from Jaipur, Samode Palace is a heritage palace cum hotel. A fusion of Muslim and Rajputana architecture, this palace in Jaipur also houses Sheesh Mahal or Hall of Mirrors. It is also surrounded by beautiful gardens which are a treat to the eyes.Entry Fees: INR 1000 per Person for both the garden & PalaceLocation: Tehsil, Village Samode, Chomu Read More 7. Hari Mahal Palace Originally a residence of Rajadhiraj Hari Singh of the Achrol family in the 1930s, Hari Mahal Palace has now been partly converted into a heritage luxury hotel. The interesting factor is that half of this palace in Jaipur is still occupied by the members of the royal family.Location: Tirthraj, Jacob Road, Civil Lines, Madrampur, Civil Lines, Jaipur Read More 8. Hawa Mahal The Hawa Mahal stands at the intersection of the main road in Jaipur, Badi Chaupad. It is regarded as the signature palaces of Jaipur and was built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh. Hawa Mahal derives its name from its unique structure, which is a mesh of small windows that allows cool wind to enter the palace and hence keeps the palace comfortable during the hot summer months.Timings: 9 AM to 5 PMEntry Fees: INR 50 for Indians and INR 200 for ForeignersLocation: Hawa Mahal Rd, Badi Choupad, J.D.A. Market, Pink City, Jaipur Read More 9. Jal Mahal Palace Amidst the chaos of the city of Jaipur, lies the splendid Jal Mahal, or Water Palace. Floating in the centre of the Sagar Lake, this low rise symmetrical palace in Jaipur was once a shooting lodge for the Maharajas. This unique palace fascinates a large number of visitors from all over the world.Timings: 12 PM to 10:30 PM other working days and 24 Hours open on WednesdayEntry Fees: INR 10 for Indians and INR 50 for ForeignersLocation: Amer Rd, Jal Mahal, Amer, Jaipur Read More 10. Shahpura Haveli Originally built as a vantage point nearly 300 years ago, Shahpura Haveli was later converted into a magnificent fortress. This is another one of the palaces in Jaipur which has now been converted into a heritage home which boasts of Indo-Saracenic style of architecture. It is frequented by celebrities, politicians and other popular artists. Location: Moti Mahal Chaupar, Shahpura. 65 KM north of central Jaipur via NH 48 Read More We hope you enjoyed our comprehensive list of the majestic forts and palaces in Jaipur, for you to choose from and make your trip a memorable one!
